title: Chris Wilder grateful to Eddie Howe for tip to bring Lys Mousset to Sheffield United
text:
Chris Wilder admits a glowing reference from Eddie Howe helped persuade him to add Lys Mousset to his newly promoted Sheffield United squad.

Mousset made the £10 million summer move to Bramall Lane after growing frustrated at his failure to progress from the role of fringe player at Howe’s Bournemouth, where he made just eight league starts in three seasons.

Two goals in a week – Saturday’s equaliser in the 1-1 draw at West Ham came five days after his winner against Arsenal – means the 23-year-old has already made his mark at his new club, although he is quickly learning there is no fast-track into the starting line-up.

Monday’s match-winning appearance was Mousset’s only league start so far and he was back on the bench at the London Stadium. His return of three goals in seven league appearances, though, is already as many as in 58 games for his former club.

Wilder is pleased with the former France Under-21 player’s impact, but insists he remains a work in progress. “Eddie Howe and Jason Tindall at Bournemouth told me how good Lys is – he just didn’t get an opportunity because of their other strikers,” the manager said. “Sometimes there comes a time for a player when he’s been at a club and can’t see things changing that he has to move on.
description: Chris Wilder admits a glowing reference from Eddie Howe helped persuade him to add Lys Mousset to his newly promoted Sheffield United squad.
